caption: We love hanging out. Last night we arrived in this excellent restaurant which friends told us about. We had a delightful experience there with fine dishes and a well-trained team and an impressive  cuisine. We put this venue in our phone list  and we will definitely go again soon. We deeply recommend.

I had an anxiety driving today so I ordered from grub hub got signature wings and their seasoned fries. And they were absolutely crazy delicious. I’ve always wanted to try Korean food especially Korean fried chicken it was everything I thought it would be! Perfect flavor for both wings (Soy garlic and Spicy) and perfectly seasoned fries cooked to perfection!! Amazing spot and super sweet Customer service!!
Would certainly recommend trying this place. Excellent vibes, flavorful food, excellent customer service. Keep up the good work.

I love this spot! They offer superb dishes, their menu is nice, The cook in that place is a real authority in the kitchen, I enjoy very much tasting all their dishes. The dishes are consistently fresh and tasty, the attitude towards the visitors  is agreeable. I  go often to this restaurant and I not even once was disappointed. Highly recommended.
(Translated by Google) Best fried chicken in all of waltham  (Original) El mejor pollo frito de todo waltham
Good quality Korean food
We ordered the boneless wings half and half and we’re pleasantly surprised with how good it was. We had gotten this before precovid and we’re not impressed at all. Glad we gave them another chance.
Delivery for signature boneless chicken wings was old and chewy and it did not even come with rice, utensils,  nakpins, and sauce.

My son ordered 1 box of the  Bonchon boneless chickens tonight. I didn't know how it is bad when my kids start to eat because I was working on a computer. When I start to eat the  Bonchon boneless chickens with my kids, it was too hard to chew and dried. I'm attaching the pictures of the food. My feeling is very sorry for my kids.
Superb atmosphere and very personal service. The food was crisp and yummy. Will easily recommend this restaurant to friends and family. Affordable rates and generous portions. Great job.

we ordered a couple time in the past with no problem. But today order are not good taste at all.  Its not double deep fried chicken.  Some chicken wings are pink.  We wont order from this place anymore.

Straight up bad. You pay a premium for the delicious texture of the really crispy fried chicken. This location falls flat on that. Have you ever had soggy chicken wings? It’s disgusting. Their japchae had like 5g of beef and no salt or flavoring. Honestly, really disappointed since Bonchon had been one of my favorite places for Korean fried chicken.
food made me sick for about 3 days. when I ordered via door dash they did not secure the food properly. very disgusting facility especially during covid

Ordered from this location hoping the bad reviews were exaggerated; but I was wrong. The chicken is okay but so small compared to other locations for being the same price! My bulgogi tastes sour and old and I found a hair in it. I love Bonchon but god am I majorly dissatisfied. :(
Spicy Chicken wings 👍🏻👍🏻
Excellent and delightful food, I loved the vibes this place has, and the cashiers were super nice. I will surely come back in the future.
Very nice food.
Fantastic and yummy food, I liked the mood this spot has, and the staff members were very welcoming. I will definitely come back again.

Ordered Bulgogi, Fried Wings, Japchae and Bibibap yesterday 9/7/2020.  They probably used expired beef on the Bulgogi as it tasted sour.  We ordered veggie Japchae but it had small pieces of beef in it and those also tasted sour.  I called to get a refund but was only given a store credit for the Bulgogi.  The fried wings were good though.

Wish we had looked at their reviews on yelp.  Absolutely terrible.  I try not to give out bad reviews but this was so bad that I had no choice.  Ordered their chicken wings.  When I have ordered from other locations, I never had any problems.  But not this location.  Half of the wings were too small to even count them as one.  They were over fried and hardened.  We asked for extra sauce and we got wings barely covered in sauce.   Wings tasted terrible as well because the oil they used was stale and probably sat there for a while.  Do yourself a favor and avoid this place like a plague.
To sum up my experience from today. Its like having rammus and yummi as bot and support. Fantastic!
Great people and great food.
The place serves large dishes and for fair pricing. helpful owner. Highly recommended.

I don’t know why, but this bonchon is so different from the one in Alston. I was really looking forward to this place opening near by, but looks like I will not be going here again. The chicken was really small and extremely salty compared to what I have had before. Also their tteokbokki was mostly onion and hardly had any actual rice cakes. For the price, I just feel it’s not worth the risk coming here and will from now drive the extra 20minutes to Alston.
I've heard the chicken here is good but the wrap with bulgogi I got was lackluster. Lots of yellow lettuce, and not a lot of meat.

I ordered from here through doordash. The soy garlic chicken was fine but the coleslaw that came with the food has gone bad. I had to throw it away. Also the "bul dak" tasted awful..  It absolutely lacked flavor and tasted very weird. Everyone who tried it could not eat it after one bite. Overall will not order from this location again and will stick to the one in Allston.

So crazy... it’s Covid and we decided to support a local business while we were in the area by picking up an order. I called to place the order over the phone and wanted to pay by credit card. I was told they could not take credit cards over the phone and that they needed to swipe the card physically in the store... Do not appreciate this as a customer at all.  Additionally, the chicken  was so salty we could barely eat it! We received a tiny portion of the sides we ordered. Just overall very disappointing!

Ｉ ordered takeout today. HoweverＩ missed something soＩcalled back to ask. First two times，no one pick up the phone，the third time a guy picked up，and he just hang up the phone while Ｉam talking！OK！So Ｉ called back again，a lady picked up，Ｉ told her again the whole thing. But she basicly wasn't listening，and her attitude was absolute rude！She hang up again while Ｉam talking！Again！Ｉ understand you guys are busy！I've been ordering bonchon for many times，at a lot of locations. This is really rude！！

I’ve been to other bon chon locations and for some reason they have way better quality and portion sizes seem much bigger than this Waltham location. I ordered the wings and rice yesterday and the wings definitely needed more sauce. Rice was half of the portion I have received from other locations. Kind of disappointed I spent $50.00 and wish I could receive a refund.

Place was nice and clean. Service was good. Food i would say Okay, as i ordered Chicken Katsu and Bibimbap. I really didn’t  like that much as this was kinda dry chicken and Bibimbap was not to that level of satisfaction as of other restaurant. I have not tried their wings, so may be i will again tryout the place for wings and redo the review. As for now i will give 3 star for service. - Went this place again and today i like it and updating with pictures and 4 star 🌟 from 3.
The food is really good!

What a shocker! I went here thinking it would have the same quality food as the Allston location and what a dissatisfied experience. The chicken was no different than frozen Tyson or Perdue chicken nuggets that were squirted with an overpowering salty liquid. I asked her what was the liquid and she said is the way it comes from the fridge 😟 disgusting. I tipped her accordingly but will never go there again! If you want BonChon chicken go to Allston. They rock!
Amazing food each and every visit.

I wish I went to ANY OTHER fast food chain instead. First of all, after asking the hostess/waitress why this Bon Chon was so different from every other location, comes to find out that the signature sauce is Pre-made. This Chicken is obviously not breaded in house; instead looks like it just came out of a bag of Tyson Chicken nuggets (yuck smh) After complaining about the overwhelming saltiness of the chicken (my plate came with 10, I only ate 2 bc of how salty it was) I was then informed that it couldn’t be taken off my bill...okayyyyy. I’m leaving this restaurant hungry, unsatisfied, and in need of a gallon of water and chapstick. Go to the Bon Chon in Allston, they’ll feed you right. Brb gonna go get my stomach pumped.

Wow, what flavor. We dined on the chicken strips with the spicy coating and man it was tasty. The fried rice was very flavorful and yummy. I also added the kimchi which hit the spot. It's an interesting place not quite fast food but faster than most sit down restaurants.
Juicy delicious crispy chicken. It is overpriced, but it is addictive. You will need to go back repeatedly
Not bad but not Brighton Bon Chon
I love spicy Bonchon chicken.
Great food with excellent ambiance
Decent food, medium sized portions, and the chicken drumsticks are massive. Nice spot for dinner with a big group. Lots of space for larger parties.
Clean and spacious place. Glad to have them in outer Boston.

The restaurant is very clean and the servers were wonderful. The food was very visually appealing unfortunately the taste was not. I had the boneless Korean fried chicken, unlike other Korean boneless chicken these tasted like store bought frozen boneless wings(breast meat). The spicy chicken tacos were too spicy and were not balanced by the coleslaw on top. It was so spicy I couldn’t taste the chicken in it or the rest of my food. I recommend using fresh chicken cutlets like some other places and ease up on the spicy chicken.
Very clean, servers are polite. I've never had to wait for seating. Food is delicious.
I waited for 1.5 hrs and finally tasted the worst fried drumstick here. The drumsticks were gigantic like turkey. Trashed them eventually. 👎🏼
Modern asian fusion fare.
Chicken yum yum
Very bad service from the waitress
(Translated by Google) The service is very bad  (Original) El servicio  es muy malo
Great fried chicken
Manager Jamie is rude and horrible.
Server tipped himself.

Do not go to this Bonchon! It’s not the same food. The Chicken is tiny wings not the the big strips people actually go for. You get half as much chicken for the same price. Go to Brighton or Harvard SQ. False advertising!

Best bone-in wings ever! Never disappointed when I get the spicy wings and as someone who loves spicy food, these are just spicy enough that adds to the overall flavor. Five stars are mostly for just the wings, but the atmosphere is great for most relaxed occasions and the service is great.
wastage of money

In comparison to other Korean chicken places the quality of the food here is very disappointing. The biggest problem is with the quality of the chicken itself. If you're going to charge 26 dollars for 10 drumsticks at least make sure the chicken is fresh because some of the ones I got were dry inside and had an unpleasant odor and aftertaste. The drum legs are also big, the size of turkey legs which might sound good to average Americans but the chicken inside had no flavor since the sauce is only coated on the outside. It wouldn't be as bad if the chicken itself was flavorful but it wasn't. If I was the store owner, I would also work on the radish because the vinegar/sugar balance is off. It takes about 3 days of pickling if you're using lesser quality radish that's not sweet to get it fully flavorful and for the bitterness to come out.

Bad costumer service, manager doesn't seem to care about customer satisfaction.  Order one of their new flavors, sweet crunch, and it was really bad.  Asked if it could get replaced they said no, asked for another sauce on the side to make it tolerable, they said no.  I was surprised, most restaurants will find a way to make things right when the customer doesn't like the food they were served, but in here they didn't even try the chicken just stayed on the table because it's not edible.

Waiters with attitude Worst experience ever Too expensive for what they serve Too lazy to change bbq pan for us First time ever in Korean bbq that you can only refill dish once Do not recommend going!

Very nice place. Order the Tteokbokki, really unique dish that I don’t see much. The wings of course are also great. I prefer this to the Harvard square location. They also have beer and wine, which goes great with the spicy food.
I ordered takoyaki (たこ焼き). They put squid in the takoyaki instead. Squid is cheaper than octopus in general.

Places a pickup order and was told 30 minutes. Showed up after 35 and was told it would be another 10. That’s fine, it happens. Waited 20 minutes and finally asked how much longer it would be and was told at least 15 more minutes. At which point I left so I don’t actually know how the food is. But the service is awful. In the time I waited I also saw that they had given someone’s order to a delivery driver and every single person who came to pickup was told it’d be 10 minutes. Which was obviously a lie so people wouldn’t cancel their orders.
Too much salt in soy fried boneless chicken, wish I had read the reviews before coming here.
Delicious food

I tried the fired chicken Soy ginger and spicy flavored wings. The soy ginger was salty but tolerable. The spicy was okay, but maybe very spicy for someone who is not used to spicy food. JUST BE AWARE that if you show up to the restaurant to get a takeout they will charge you firs before telling you that you need to wait 25 freaking minutes for a small box of wings. This to me sounds like a scam and it's not polite at all. Next time please tell how long it will take for my order before charging money.

Not sure why the ratings are so low here - I actually love the Korean style fried chicken here, and they got my food for pickup in ~5 min. Nothing to complain!  But remember this is a fried chicken place, so not expect too much for other part of it.
Great service, good food.

(Translated by Google) I found it nice, some very rich wings, and others excessively spicy, unfortunately because of that excess of spicy you can not enjoy how delicious the wings  (Original) Me pareció bi3n , unas alitas muy ricas, y otras excesivamente picante,  lamentablemente por ese exceso de picante no puedes disfrutar lo delicioso d3 las alitas

The Fried Chicken wings are excellent. We also ordered Chicken Buldak (the spiciest dish on the menu) and it was amazing. If you are not a fan of spicy food, you can always ask for the less spicy version of it.
Over priced for the amount  of food you get
Best fried chicken I ever had
The chicken wings are good, but the bibimbap is too dry and very plain.
Got the bibimbap chicken, and all I could taste was fish sauce. Had to buy pepto bismol extra strength the day after.
Delicious chicken! Super friendly staff :)
Awesome chicken
Two stars only for the flavor of chicken, for french fries, Korea hamburger, service, no star
Good fusion food, but the highlight was the dubuki! Very flavorful!

Went during the soft opening. Menu was pretty good and the prices were okay, but the food made me quite sick after eating it and I am not sure I will be going back anytime soon if that is what I can expect.

Edit: I called the number left on the response by the owner and there's no answer. That being said, they asked for more info so I re-added my original review below that I deleted because I felt bad for writing it. I do feel bad leaving negative reviews so I'll add a beginning warning that you may like this location if you have never been to any of their other locations first.  I'll start by saying I am huge fan of Bonchon. I frequent the Allston location at least once a month but it's an hour drive to do so. Obviously I was excited to cut that drive down by 20 minutes when they opened this location in Waltham.  Unfortunately, I probably will not be going back. I got the soy garlic wings, the spicy wings, and the potstickers to go. My friend and I both grabbed a potsticker in the car before heading home and couldn't help but comment how unbearably salty it was. Later, while eating at home, I found out that all of the items were ridiculously salty. The items are almost inedible due to how much salt is on them. I mean, I was reaching for a beverage after every bite salty. In terms of texture, it reminds me of caramel popcorn. It terms of taste, it's like dumping salt all over a wing. Even the coleslaw is just meh compared to the other location. The spicy wings were actually alright but in comparison to the Allston location it just doesn't hold a candle.  The "ADDICTED YET" slogan being on these wings honestly just makes me upset knowing how much better it could be.  PLEASE do not judge Bonchon on this location. Go to the one in Allston, it is so much better it's hard to put into words. I still love Bonchon and plan to keep going, I'm just going to continue making the extra 20 minute drive to the Allston location.

*7/1/19 update. I gave this place a second chance and this time the chicken was perfect! I think they learned to add more sauce and cook the chicken correctly. The thighs were so juicy and flavorful! Service was great and the staff were very nice. Changed from 3 starts to 5.*  -Old review-  I really wanted to give this place 5 stars before I've been looking forward to having a good fried chicken place close for a while. But they have some issues that I'm hoping will be fixed in time.  The bad:  First off the hot tea we ordered was room temperature. The hot water coming out of your faucet is way hotter than this tea. I mean what restaurant does not have the ability to boil water?  Second they got my order wrong, but quickly fixed the error. They did forget the appetizer until I asked them for it after we got the main meal.  Third the sauce was super sparse. I thought they would toss the wings in the sauce fully like every other Bonchon, but they barely just drizzled some sauce on each one separately, a few drops each.  Forth the person I was with thought the boneless chicken was super dry, but the coating was nice and crisp. My order was not dry. Maybe the bone in wings are juicier.  The good:  Even though they got the order messed up a bit, the server was very nice and remedied the issues as best they could.  The fried pickles were good and hot and the fried chicken was good overall but lacking sauce!  I just hope they can have a bit more sauce on their chicken, fix the small issues with service, and figure out how to boil water for a decent cup of tea.
Good tasting food but small portions compared to the amount charged!!!!!!!$$$$$
Great service and food, served very quickly. New furniture, small bar area, and lots of local stores to walk to. Parking in the rear.
We had takeout and dined in and both were great experiences. Delicious food and efficient, friendly service!
Tasty Asian fusion. Bulgogi burgers, kimchi, spicy chicken wings, and edamame are some good options.
Spicy Chicken Tacos were good, and the the Japchae (glass noodles) was good and spicy. I look forward to returning.

Great new atmosphere, fresh and clean. The food is just as good as the Allston restaurant. The menu is slightly different. You have to get some chicken while you are here. Be careful of the hot, it's really hot.
Ordered Bibimbap and fried tofu pickup. Nether came with sauce. Very plain taste.
Wouldn't honor lunch specials on their menu and the rest was overpriced. There's better on Moody.

now this place is not that good you could have bought the stuff in the store and it would have probably been better. it says 30 minutes for the chicken to be cooked it took him 15 it was store-bought chicken out of a bag like I said we could have did this at our own house
Some of the best wings I ever had!!! Cleanest bathroom too!
That Korean chicken was FIYA!

The quality and size of the chicken is terrible compared to the one in Allston Massachusetts. If you go there don't expect much from here. We ordered the boneless wings and they were like the size and quality of a frozen chicken nugget from a grocery store. It's not like the big chicken strips like in Allston.

Do not go to this Bonchon.  Drive the extra 15 minutes to the one in Allston.  The wings were tiny and dried up, and included the bony tips.  The order of fried rice was not even enough for one person, and did not taste good. Just stay away. It'd be no star if possible.

Ordered wings for a large party.  The wings were very small, hardly any meat on them. We've been to the Allston location many times and have liked their food so when Waltham opened up we thought we try it. Our guests also noticed how skimpy the wings were too.  We did not feel that we got a good value so we will not be coming back.
Good food and service. However, portion sizes for entrees were a bit smaller than what they looked like in the menu card.

We ordered the medium boneless chicken (half spicy, half soy garlic), japchae, and potstickers (half spicy, half soy garlic). While everything tasted okay, the portions were pretty small for the price. We waited 40 minutes for chicken that came out looking basically like Tyson frozen chicken nuggets, very small pieces with barely any sauce. We came during the soft opening, so I just hope they will take this time to straighten out any kinks in their system and improve upon their food before the grand opening. I don't mean to be completely negative, but because I've tried another location of Bonchon, I know that it can be better. Edit: other friends have tried it after I did and agreed, even after the grand opening, that the food is not as good as other locations. However, the service has improved.

Takeout orders have been fresh and delicious, but the one time I tried to dine in I ended up having to walk out after 55 minutes of waiting for my wife's dinner order to be served. Hopefully they can work out the kinks because the wings here are absolutely delicious.
